Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Resident is engaging in an inappropriate relationship with a staff Yes

III. METHODOLOGY
04/20/2020 Special Investigation Intake
2020C0219029

04/20/2020 Contact - Document Received.
04/30/2020 Exit conference.
ALLEGATION: Resident is engaging in an inappropriate relationship with a staff
member at the facility.
INVESTIGATION:
Intake dated 04/20/2020 was reviewed. It states Resident A is engaging in an
inappropriate relationship with a female staff member at the facility. They have had
conversations through social media about meeting up once he is discharged from
the program or when he is on home visits in which they have exchanged words such
as "I love you". When at the facility they are inappropriate and have been known to
brush up against each other and have said things to one another (unknown what).
The facility has not been made aware of the interactions between the two at this
point. There is no indication that anything further between Resident A and the
female staff member has occurred up to this point. Screen shots of Staff Person 1’s
Instagram messages with Resident A were attached and the female staff was
identified by the facility.
Seven screen shot Instagram messages between Staff Person 1 and Resident A
were reviewed. Staff Person 1’s identity was verified by facility administration via
her attached picture to the Instagram thread. Resident A’s paraphrased messages
to Staff Person 1 include his proclaimed love for her and asking her to visit him at his
home on more than one occasion. Staff Person 1’s paraphrased messages to
Resident A include two apologizes for being unable to visit him at home though
indicates one possibility, questioning where they would go if met, and addresses him
as “love” one time.
2

Referral Source was interviewed via telephone by Detective and Chief Administrator
on 04/20/2020. Summary of the interview is as follows:
Referral Source believed an employee and her brother at the facility were
having contact that she believed was more than just appropriate. Resident
A has eight-hour home visits per week due to her health condition. At a
holiday function at the facility in 2019 Resident A introduced Staff Person
1 to her stating that he was “in love with her” which concerned Referral
Source. She reports Staff Person 1 exhibited extra attention to Resident A
during the gathering and would speak with him often. Referral Source
states Staff Person 1 and other staff have stated that they loved her
brother, but that Staff Person 1’s statement concerned her noting that
Staff Person 1 is just “too friendly” with him. Referral Source learned of
Resident A and Staff Person 1’s communications after a home visit when
Resident A did not log off his Instagram account through her cell phone.
Referral Source has not observed Resident A and Staff Person 1 together,
has not seen Staff Person 1 at her residence, and does not believe there
has been any sexual contact.
Resident A was interviewed onsite by Detective and Chief Administrator on
04/20/2020. Summary of the interview is as follows:
Resident A was advised he was not a suspect and intent of interview is to
gather facts regarding the allegations. He presented as extremely stand
offish and failed to answer questions most times refusing to answer how
he and Staff Person 1 initiated contact outside of the facility. It was
determined that communication occurred through Instagram though who
initiated the first contact was not determined. Resident A reported that
Staff Person 1 told him that she loved him and that he also loved her.
Chief Administrator to conduct follow-up interview to see if additional facts
can be obtained.
Staff Person 1 was interviewed onsite by Detective and Chief Administrator on
04/20/2020. Summary of the interview is as follows:
Staff Person 1 is the primary direct care worker on Resident A’s pod. She
reports Referral Source made a complaint about her and Resident A
communicating. She reported Resident A contacted her through
Instagram months ago. She responded because Resident A “opened up”
to her and that she wanted to check on him while on home visits. She
reports since her interactions with Resident A that he has become less
suicidal and opened-up to her regarding his troubles. She agreed with
Detective that her interaction with Resident A was inappropriate. She
reported that she violated departmental policy though never met Resident
A in person and that no inappropriate physical contact was made. Staff
Person 1 agreed to a polygraph if requested.
3

Staff Person 1 personnel record indicates her date of hire occurring on 07/17/2019.
She completed orientation and she signed copies of Professional Boundaries:
Employee Relationships with Consumers and Prisoner Rape Elimination Act on
07/17/2019, as well as updated copies on 03/05/2020.
Facility Professional Boundaries: Employee Relationships with Consumers policy
was reviewed. It states, “Prohibited activities and relationships that are indicative of
an unprofessional boundary relationship include but are not limited to the following:
Initiating or engaging in any unauthorized contact with consumers following a
consumers discharge from the program (including telephone contact,
correspondence, face to face contact, contact via messenger or electronic means)…
as well as, Initiating or encouraging personal relationships of any kind with
consumers… All incidental contacts with past consumers must be reported to the
Program Director within 24-hours of the contact. This report must be verbal and in
writing. Failure to report will be interpreted as a willful violation of the Professional
Boundary Policy.” Staff person 1 was trained in the policy during her initial
orientation on 07/17/2019 and again on 11/29/2016.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents'
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
4

ANALYSIS: Staff Person 1 violated the facilities Professional Boundaries:
Employee Relationships with Consumers policy by engaging in
social media contact with Resident A while on home visits and
not informing administration. It does not appear as though Staff
Person 1 and Resident A met outside of the facility or engaged
in any form of sexual contact. Per Detective interview, Staff
Person 1 knew her interactions with Resident A was
inappropriate and knew she violated facility policy.
REPEAT CITATION with SIR#2019C0219028 initiated on
04/18/2019 regarding informing facility of resident social media
contact with staff outside the facility.
REPEAT CITATION with SIR#2018C0219051 initiated on
05/18/2018 regarding physical contact of a resident after
discharge in another facility, which also notes prior repeat
citations.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an approved corrective action plan no change to the current license
is recommended.
